snippet: A ballot measure in Georgia asks voters to decide on a statewide commission that could authorize new charter schools.
abstract: Ballot measure in Georgia asks voters to decide on a statewide commission that could authorize new charter schools; legislative efforts to expand charter schools are among the most contentious issues in education circles; proponents say charters can experiment with new teaching strategies to help struggling students, while detractors say they are drain public money and energy from neighborhood schools.
lead_paragraph: A ballot measure in Georgia asks voters to decide on a statewide commission that could authorize new charter schools.

headline.seo: Future of Georgia’s Charter Schools on Ballot
headline.main: Georgia’s Voters Will Decide on Future of Charter Schools
headline.print_headline: Georgia’s Voters Will Decide On Future of Charter Schools
